lexUnit.name: mouth.v

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: say (something) in an insincere or pompous way

sentence.text: Leila called , and then turned to Roirbak who mouthed silently , ` Let her go . "
` Yes ? " he mouthed , staring .
“ Ella Fitzgerald , ” he mouthed , “ Kate Millett , Nancy Reagan , Benazir Bhutto … ”
` So I 'm a beggar on horseback , am I ? " he mouthed hoarsely .
I mouthed , ` I 've been warned , " and we changed over without uttering a word .
` Smile , " he mouths , trying to attract your attention .
Ember mouthed , ` Could you just shuck off your outer suit , Jez ?
` Probably , " Cardiff mouthed , naked fear making him tremble as he reached the step above the thing .
` Spies , " he mouthed .
Her face was bruised and battered , one eye swelling rapidly , and she was mouthing , ` Help me , please help me , " over and over again .
` Tina 's brother Steve , " mouthed Jack at Ho .
“ Not a car bomb … ” mouthed Duvall .
` Stupid , " mouthed Caspar at Fenella , under cover of the serving of half a dozen roast boars .
This time Sir John woke , shaking himself like a dog , mouthing the most terrible curses .
We passed Swire Sugden out for a walk and when he saw us he held out his arms and mouthed a farewell .
A cart crashed by , its driver mouthing oaths .
Realizing the kicks that many men get out of listening to women mouthing obscenities , he set up a unique telephone service to cater for the need and gave it the name Just Filmz Inc .
Silly-Willie mouthed some sort of goodbye .
She half mouthed the word , as though it were not quite suitable for a polite tea-table .
Out of the corner of my eye I saw Natalie stand up , salute and begin to silently mouth the words of the Promise !
The words were mouthed ; they must not be detected .
` I hear the bulldozers are moving in on George Eliot Thursday , " mouthed one of his colleagues in a satisfied Southern drawl .
The American sat there , mouthed a few more obscenities before sinking into a deep sulk as he nursed his hurt pride .
Ryker shot an angry glance at Donna and mouthed something she could n't make out .
` Good morning and thank you , " I answered , mouthing the words carefully .
So I mouthed the words nice and slowly . "
Charlie shook his head and mouthed the word ` Tonight ! "
Athelstan went over and knelt beneath the small , horn-glazed window , crossed himself and gently mouthed the words of David 's psalm .
Sam and Rose mouthed at each other : ` Candle by the bed , " and nodded .
His lips were moving quietly as he mouthed to himself what he would do if ever he had Corbett in his power .
Unseen by Victor , he mouthed to me , ` Maggie ? " , lifting an eyebrow in query .
I told her and mouthed to Nigel who it was , and did he want to speak to her ?
Lucy found herself mouthing like a mill worker to make herself understood over the noise , which was louder than any machinery .
` Oh Christ , oh Christ , " I mouthed in a panic and first set about getting the sticking plaster off him .
I mouthed back , ` He say anything ? "
` Soldiers , " he mouthed back .
Emily left me , mouthing as she went out of the door that she was going back to the office .
I felt the temblor begin and glanced at the table next to mine , smiled that guilty smile and we both mouthed the words , `` Earth-quake ! '' together .
